channel.title: Error: T1 - 123,0 - 36,36 on Moparscape!
channel.description:
Hello,
i have download Soulsplit source and client in 1 now iam runnig the server..so iam think yes!! hes is online.....
when i try to log in on the moparscape client iam logging in see black screen and iam disscon. so i have google it i have removes the crashscreen the player icons or something but i still get this error who can help my?

item.title: Error: T1 - 123,0 - 36,36 on Moparscape!
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:


should be

[code]//playerProps.writeByte(headIcon);[/code]

Or the other way around.

should be

Or the other way around.

Read full topic

item.title: Error: T1 - 123,0 - 36,36 on Moparscape!
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Error: T1 - 123,0 - 36,36

A t1 error occurs when a packet is sent from the server to the client that the client doesn’t recognize. Check all your outbound packets and make sure none of them are foreign to the client.

Error: T1 - 123,0 - 36,36 Help?

The Head Icons Are mis configured.

[quote=“Rix_, post:3, topic:370968”]This has got nothing to do with which operating systems you’re running the client on. A T1 error happens when there is an unknown packet type.

The format of a T1 error is as follows:
T1 - , , , [/quote]

MoparScape connection

There is a chance you are logging into a server which has items which aren’t supported in your client. You’ll need to download the specific client for that server, or use a client that can support the server.

May have something to do with this in your playerassistant.java I dont know for sure…

public void sendCrashFrame() { // used for crashing cheat clients synchronized(c) { if(c.getOutStream() != null && c != null) { c.getOutStream().createFrame(); c.flushOutStream(); } } }

good luck none the less with the error.

Read full topic
